comment.author: 66311327@N05
66311327@N05
comment._content: In 1916, L. C. Ledyard was charged as former director of the New York, New Haven & Hartford railroad with criminal violation of the Sherman anti-trust law, see The Day book., January 10, 1916, LAST EDITION, Image 27: SIX NEW HAVEN MEN FREED - FIVE DISAGREED ON

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you so much for your research B-59. We'll fill in the names and add birth and death dates for these two attorneys. Because we can't pin down the date that the photo was taken, I'm not sure if we'll know if it was taken after Ledyard was charged.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: It would not be unusual if there were grand jury proceedings prior to charges being brought.  It's possible these pictures were taken in the hallway of a courthouse.
